title: Introduction to Python - Module Assessment
description: Test your understanding of Python basics!

questions.question: What is Python?
options: A programming language that lets us give instructions to computers
questions.explanation: Python is a programming language that helps us communicate with computers!

questions.question: What do we use variables for in Python?
questions.explanation: Variables are like boxes that store information we want to use later!

questions.question: Which of these is the correct way to store your name in a variable?
questions.explanation: We use the = sign to store information in a variable!

questions.question: What does the print() function do?
questions.explanation: print() shows information on the computer screen so we can see it!

questions.question: What type of information is 'Hello World'?
questions.explanation: Text surrounded by quotes is called a string in Python!

questions.question: What type of information is the number 25?
questions.explanation: 25 is a whole number, which we call an integer in Python!

questions.question: What will this code show: print('I am ' + '8 years old')?
What will this code show: print(5 + 3)?
Which symbol do we use to store information in a variable?
questions.explanation: The = symbol assigns (stores) values into variables!

questions.question: What makes Python special for beginners?
options: It looks like English and is easy to read
It only works on old computers
questions.explanation: Python is designed to be readable and friendly for beginners!
